newsitem.title: SENEGAL: Senegal lifts ban on Islamic movement.
newsitem.headline: Senegal lifts ban on Islamic movement.

text.p: Senegalese President Abdou Diouf has lifted a ban on an Islamic movement whose members were involved in 1994 political riots in which six policemen and two civilians were killed, state television reported on Sunday.

The television, which announced the move in the run-up to Senegal's November 24 municipal elections, said the Moustarchidina Wal Moustarchidati movement's spiritual leader, Cheikh Tidiane Sy, would meet Diouf in the near future.
Some 200 members of the Islamic group attended a campaign rally held last week by Diouf's ruling Socialist Party.

The movement was banned after a February 1994 pro-opposition rally involving members of the movement in Dakar turned violent. Twenty three members of the movement, whose name means men and women who follow the truth, were later jailed.
